Description: A Nevada defense contractor agreed to pay the United States $320,000 to settle allegations that the company sold improperly tested electronic parts to the U.S. Department of Defense and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration for a number of military and aerospace programs.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2000/March/102civ.htm

Description: Maxwell Technologies Inc. agreed to pay an $8 million criminal penalty to resolve Foreign Corrupt Practices Act charges of bribing Chinese government officials to secure sales of Maxwell's products to state-owned manufacturers of electric-utility infrastructure in several Chinese provinces.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/maxwell-technologies-inc-resolves-foreign-corrupt-practices-act-investigation-and-agrees-pay
https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2011/2011-31.htm

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Description: SolarCity Corporation agreed to pay $29.5 million to resolve allegations that it violated the False Claims Act by submitting inflated claims on behalf of itself and affiliated investment funds to the U.S. Department of the Treasury pursuant to Section 1603 of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/solarcity-agrees-resolve-alleged-false-claims-act-violations-arising-renewable-energy-grant
https://www.sec.gov/news/press-release/2018-48

Description: At the same time that Tesla CEO Elon Musk agreed to settle securities fraud allegations, the company settled allegations of failing to have required disclosure controls and procedures relating to Musk's tweets. Musk and the company each agreed to pay a penalty of $20 million.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/news/press-release/2018-226
https://www.law360.com/articles/1086837/calif-judge-gives-initial-ok-to-1m-tesla-overtime-deal

Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/us-epa-settles-tesla-over-hazardous-waste-violations-fremont-calif-facility

Company: Tesla Energy Solutions (fka SolarCity) and Novogradac & Company LLP
Description: Oregon received $13 million in a settlement with solar developer Tesla Energy Solutions (formerly known as SolarCity) and its accounting firm, Novogradac & Company LLP resolving allegations that they submitted false applications to the Oregon Department of Energy, resulting in more than $10 million in unjustified Business Energy Tax Credits.
Info Source: https://www.doj.state.or.us/media-home/news-media-releases/attorney-general-rosenblum-announces-settlement-with-solarcity-and-novogradac-over-oregons-business-energy-tax-credit-program/
https://real.flofr.com/datamart/searchFinalOrderFLOFR.do

Description: Tesla agreed to pay $5.4 million to settle class action litigation alleging that it delayed implementing safety features and when it did the collision avoidance and automatic braking systems were defective.
Private Litigation Case Title: Dean Sheikh et al v. Tesla, Inc.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1047829/tesla-to-pay-5-4m-to-end-autopilot-safety-features-row

Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/us-epa-settles-tesla-over-clean-air-act-violations-fremont-calif-facility

Description: Settlement of fine for self-reported violation of asbestos regulations.
Agency: South Coast (CA) Air Quality Management District
Info Source: http://www.aqmd.gov/docs/default-source/Agendas/Governing-Board/2014/2014-may2-013.pdf?sfvrsn=2
